text: The Yapacana antbird (Myrmeciza disjuncta) is a species of bird in the Thamnophilidae family. It is found in Brazil, Colombia, and Venezuela. The species was named by Friedmann, in 1945. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. ==References== * BirdLife International 2004. Myrmeciza disjuncta. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 26 July 2007. Category:Tyranni Category:Birds of South America
title: Yapacana antbird
